coded_answer.p: Dear Madam
I am writing to answerprovide the informationsinformation that you need from me.
First I would like to thank you for doingorganising this competition and I would also like to thank you for the prize.
Answering your questions, I would like to travel only enin July because this is the month of my vacationsvacation. In July I will be free to travel anywhere I please.

According to your letter, I have two options ofregarding accommodation, oreither in tents or log cabins. I would prefer ina tentstent because I think that is something more exciting and new for me. I never stayedhave never stayed in a tentstent in the middle of nowhere, in my life so I would prefer something more realistic and new. Log cabins may be more confortablecomfortable, on. On the other hand I think that I will be able to "survive" in a tentstent. Looking toat your letter, I can see many options offor activities and I realizedrealize that I like most of them. I think I would prefer Climbing and Painting. The reason offor choosing thisthese two activities is that they contrast with itselvesthemselveseach other,. I want one that is more exciting and that asks for more agility and another that is more calmcalmer and relaxing, that asks only for my ability to paint. Climbing is something new for me and I am not so good onat thatit, however, I wishhope that I can learn about it onat the Camp. Painting is something that I love and I am very good doingat it.
I have some doubtsworries about my prize and travel. Is there aany possibility that you could send me a list of materialequipment and clothes that I have to take?
Is alleverything on the traveltrip already paid for, including food and meals, or do I have to bring some money?
Do I have to bring something especialspecial for the tentstent and camping?
Please answer my letter as soon as is possible.
YourYours faithfully,
GUSTAV SOARES.
Dear Kim,
How are you? Is everything good in the USA?
I'm writing to you because I had a wonderful experience last month.

There was a concert ofwith a famous band here in my city. I vishwish you werehad been here with me. So, I went with my friend to the concert with a lot of fans. We bought tickets to the show and also to the fan'sfans' bus. Yes, there is a bus that taketakes you to the concert and bringbrings you back.

The concert was going to start at 22:00 and the bus arrived at my house at 18:00. When we enteredgot inside of it, we saw a lot of fans usingwearing T-shirts, caps and shouting, "Almendegos, Almendegos..." (that is the name of the band).
AT 20:00, we stopped inat a coffee house to eat. TheThey shouted: "20:30 you all have to be back because the bus will leave."

We sat and started to eat and talk. Suddenly a man came and started to tell us his adventures. They were very interesting and we liked him sovery much. After a few minutes (I foughtthought they were a few) I realized that the coffee house was empty. I looked toat my watch: 20:45. The bus had left about fifteen minutes before. The man offered us a ride. We acceptaccepted. You can notcannot imagine how dissapointeddisappointed I werewas with my ownselfmyself.

When we arrived the concert had already beganbegun. When we were running to enter a man called us. He was helping to put the materialsequipment of the concertsconcertconcert equipment (microphone...) on the stage. He asked if we could help. We answered: "Yes!"
We started to put everthingeverything on the stage and after this we realized that the band was enteringcoming intoonto the stage near us.

By my side the vocalvocalist of the Almendegos wasThe vocalist of the Almendegos was by my side and he touched my arm. I will never wash my arm again. After all of this we saw the show infrom the best place, near of the stage and afterafterwards, the thing that I most liked, we were convidatedinvited to see the group and hadgot their signatures.
That was the best night of my life.
I wishhope that you liked my experience.
Kisses,
GUSTAV.
